comment: Can't really speak on Dr. Kang as a professor. He didn't teach, he was just an administrator. If it isn't mandatory to take this class, don't. Save your money, time, and mental health. The labs test and project are all using ArcGis. Software that you may have 0 experience with. You will spend countless hours trying to do these activities.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment:
If you don't have to take this class, maybe don't, but don't be intimidated if you do. 

Time-consuming? 1000% but not impossible. I would take this in a lighter semester. Focus on following directions, and you will be ok. He will help you SO MUCH with your project, but you need to ask. Do all the quizzes/discussions, it helps your grade A LOT.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I took GEOG 1125, Expect to write and read a lot. Stay on top of submissions, he is work heavy. Great professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment:
You will be dealing with a lot of technology. Technology that is bound to screw up. The work itself isn't hard, but it's a lot. The hardest part about the class is managing all of the technology
You have to jump through hoops every week to figure these different programs out. They glitch out a lot. I would never take this course again for my sanity
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Everything is online, so no need to go to class since he doesn't teach anything related to the work. 2 week periods to complete each module. Lots of work so don't procrastinate. Labs suck, but other than that this class isn't super hard.

Like other reviewers have mentioned, this professor does not teach the class. He did not even make most of the modules that he teaches with, and asking him questions about how they work can be pointless. He took points off an assignment and claimed I did not do part of the work, and I had to email him to actually grade my work.
He does not teach. He just assigns work and expects you to do everything, though it is an online course. It isnt a good one. The modules dont make sense and he isnt helpful. 0/10.

DO NOT, I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! The work it's self is not difficult but beware, you will be bound to a computer 6 hours straight each week doing "concepts". There is also a weekly test, a self quiz and on top of all that a lab. The labs are awful and make no sense. I did not learn a single thing in this class. Save yourself the headache

You will pass this class as long as you do all the work. But personally the workload was kind of crazy at least if you did it last minute like me. But even if you were to spread the homework out over time you would consistently be doing something for his class. I have finished his class for the semester and im still missing 20 grades that finished
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I cannot speak for Dr. Kang himself as the class was entirely asynchronous online. The material was all through an extension website and was very drawn out with lots of reading from the textbook. I personally would not take this class again solely because if I wanted to teach myself a course, I would have. Also, not very quick to respond to emails.
